author.name: Conchobar mac Dubhthach
author.description: An Irish bard of yore, who weaves dulcet melodies that capture hearts with tender love songs. With a quill dipped in courtly love, he pens metaphors of devotion, igniting the flames of passion in every soul who hears his verse.

newsMedieval:
In eastern reaches where the dragon stirs,
Economic woes compare, dire to Japan's curse.
Yet verily, I say, the knot doth only tighten,
For China's future harks a shadow, woefully frightening.

Beyond where Dnieper's currents swiftly flow,
Ukraine faces a relentless, icy foe.
In the midst of strife, the fickle heavens weep,
Impeding Kyiv's hope for victory's sweet leap.

Alas for Wenner, once held in fame's embrace,
Ousted from the Hall, he falls from grace.
His words, misguided, land a bitter blow,
In the court of public thought, deemed a foe below.

feedItems.title: Is China's Economic Predicament as Bad as Japan's? It Could Be Worse
feedItems.description: China is facing some economic challenges that Japan didn’t after its 1980s bubble.

feedItems.title: Ukraine's Next Battlefield Foe: Bad Weather
feedItems.description: Drenching rain and icy cold could impede Kyiv’s chance of exploiting an eventual breakthrough.

feedItems.title: Rolling Stone's Jann Wenner Ousted From Rock & Roll Hall of Fame Board
feedItems.description: The magazine’s co-founder was removed from the Rock & Roll Hall of Fame’s foundation board a day after the New York Times published comments he made in an interview that were considered sexist and racist.

author.name: Guillemette de Ventadour
author.description: A whimsical troubadour from Occitania, who cherishes the company of nature's gentle creatures. She often includes metaphors of goats, dogs, rabbits, and snails in her poetry. Her writing style is terse.

newsMedieval:
On the stage of strife, ablaze and stark,
Bereft of toil, lies an empty park.
Four million days as silent doves,
A strike in the heart, the worker starves.

Athletes preen, in glories glow,
Inflamed by secrets only they know.
With pulses of light, and cold's embrace,
They seek to quicken their weary race.

In jester's folly, realtors tread,
In affairs of heart, their honor bled.
"What could go wrong?" the snail does sigh,
As secrets fester 'neath twinkling sky.

feedItems.title: The U.S. Lost 4.1 Million Days of Work Last Month to Strikes
feedItems.description: Even before the UAW walkout, the number of days lost to work stoppages had risen to its highest level in more than two decades.

feedItems.title: Elite Athletes Swear by These Extreme Treatments. Scientists Think They Could Boost Your Health, Too.
feedItems.description: Cutting-edge sports-performance therapies using infrared light, electromagnetic pulses and cold potentially have longer-term benefits, researchers say

feedItems.title: More »
feedItems.description: When realtors get caught up in their client's extramarital affairs. "What could go wrong?"

author.name: Æthelred the Skald
author.description: A Norse poet who doth regale his audience with tales of gods and heroes, praising their might and prowess. He references Norse mythology and history in his poems. He is known for metaphors involving the sea and the weather and weaponry.

newsMedieval:
In debtor's cuffs, their purses drained, a beast, fierce loan-dragon roars,
Young scholars’ plight foretells of blight, the market's future soars.
Dreadful price of learning's feast, leaves kinsmen's coffers torn,
A chilling tide for retailers wide, a spending frost is born.

The sun now sets on boomers bold, as homelessness draws nigh,
A life once held, now lost, unsold, beneath the weeping sky.
Once proud as thrones, now cast as stones, the generation falls,
In Odin's stead, the harsh wheel tread, the cruelest of the thralls.

The Texan Thane, in scandal bathed, does slip the hangman's noose,
His guilt evaded, honor shaded, in the court's recluse.
The senate's gaze did not amaze, their judgement clatters fair,
Paxton stands, with unstained hands, the trial's icy air.

feedItems.title: Student-Loan Restart Threatens to Pull $100 Billion Out of Consumers' Pockets
feedItems.description: The resumption of the payments will leave some U.S. consumers squeezed and some of the nation’s largest retailers fearing a spending slowdown.

feedItems.title: More »
feedItems.description: Why more baby boomers are sliding into homelessness

feedItems.title: Texas Attorney General Ken Paxton Avoids Conviction in Impeachment Trial
feedItems.description: The state senate acquits official accused of improperly aiding a donor and using a donor to facilitate his extramarital affair.

author.name: Brother Arnulfus
author.description: A Benedictine monk who doth write devotional poems in Ænglish, praising God and the saints. His poems are often humorous, short, and satirical. They often contain metaphors of alcohol, especially wine or ale.

newsMedieval:
Lee, perchance a beast now tamed,
On coastal shores he now hath claimed.
Stay ye sheltered, avoid the ale,
Lest in his tempest, you do ail.

An Egyptian scribe of potent quill,
In Nile's cold keep, now lies still.
Sisi seeks yet another round,
Whilst silence doth oppugn the sound.

A Yankeeman of wheaten heart,
In Spanish Vuelta makes his start.
Though kin pursue with eager zeal,
His victory the Lord will seal.

feedItems.title: Lee, Now a Post-Tropical Cyclone, Makes Landfall Saturday
feedItems.description: People are urged to stay indoors as dangerous surf batters eastern New England and Atlantic Canada.

feedItems.title: Top Egyptian Journalist Jailed Ahead of Elections
feedItems.description: Hisham Kassem, an opposition journalist in Egypt, is sentenced to six months in prison ahead of elections in which President Sisi is seeking a third six-year term.

feedItems.title: American Cyclist Sepp Kuss Set to Win the Vuelta a España
feedItems.description: Despite a challenge from his own teammates, the Colorado native will become the first U.S. winner of a Grand Tour in 10 years.
